text: The Ormeau Bridge, looking upstream, in 2011 The Ormeau Bridge is a road bridge in Belfast, roughly 80m long, carrying the A24 Ormeau Road across the River Lagan from Stranmillis Embankment to Ormeau Embankment. The bridge was opened in 1863 and designed by Charles Lanyon to a near-identical standard as his earlier Queen's Bridge. It replaced an earlier, less stable structure dating from 1809. https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001287/18090703/016/0003At some point in the 20th Century the bridge was widened to accommodate increased traffic. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northern Ireland Category:Transport in Belfast Category:Buildings and structures in Belfast
title: Ormeau Bridge
